topic.title: Elm-ZeroNet
topic.body:
>  Elm - programming language for declaratively creating web browser-based graphical user interfaces. Elm is purely functional, and is developed with emphasis on usability, performance, and robustness. It advertises "no runtime exceptions in practice", made possible by the Elm compiler's static type checking.

Hello, everyone!

I'm glad to introduce [Elm-ZeroNet](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ANAneTCtamh2dgZrJWNPNMTEX8iXKawPg/) - a toolkit to build zites using Elm language. It is early beta, not all ZeroFrame API features are supported for now, but I think it's ready for testing.

This demo page created with Elm-ZeroNet as well.

Future plans: More support of ZeroFrame APIs, more Docs and Guides.

Unfortantly, English isn't my native language, so, typos and error may and will occur in documentation and I will very happy, if someone could help to improve this.

Any issues or pull-request are welcome

topic.title: ZeroNet peers import\export
topic.body: Can I export and import peers from zeronet installs? Becaus of Internet blocking fresh zeronet install doesn't connect to peers, but my old install works fine and I wan't to share my peers

1549333095_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbE.body: You can use any framework :) More tricky thing is using elm, as far as I know

1578051507_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3Rd.body: Whhoops, will fix it soon. For now only api reference are usable, no docs or guides are created

> [caryoscelus](#comment_287_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): happens right on page load

hmmm, are you using an updated version of this zite?

> [caryoscelus](#comment_288_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): i didn't set it on pause, but maybe it wasn't updated yet.. now it doesn't do that anymore. still, the only thing working seems to be API Reference.

That true, only API Reference is working now, a need more work to do to add docs and guides

1555759517_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body: ohmygod. It works pretty nice! Good job!

1597160449_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3Rd.body: No, I meen transfer some peers database to another people, that wants to use ZeroNet
At least I tried to run on my android phone at the same network (wifi), but on android it does not run at all. ZeroHello page does not loaded

> [marcusfinch](#comment_6_1JKZJh2XYF8C6q5p7T7FmiL3JDux2CxWyJ): There's an android app for ZeroNet in the playstore.  Is that what you're using?

No, I download it from github releases page. Play store was not working in that time

> [marcusfinch](#comment_7_1JKZJh2XYF8C6q5p7T7FmiL3JDux2CxWyJ): I can't think of a way to share them.  But maybe the problem is they can't get to the trackers?  It might be a  DNS block in which case if you give them the IP of the trackers they should be able to connect and get peers. [...]

trackers.json does not changed from fresh install on my pc. I will try, but not sure, that it helps. Thanks.
Thanks for ypur's help, will check some solutions, but for now goverment unlocked an Internet connection. For now at least

> [otbtechnologies7](#comment_90_1BULx3pdbqxqTWCSBvSQijujiHhXJT1D3w): Other possible solutions: Use VPS or RDP connection to server outside of Belarus in privacy respecting jurisdiction and pay with cryptocurrency such as Monero for anonymity purposes. Or, perhaps using an Elite SOCKS5 Proxy for all of your computer's internet traffic.  [...]

In the moment of total blocking, ssh tunnels was not working :( Guess, that it will not help if it repeats
